summary: Yom Kippur is the most sacred day in Judaism, occurring in late September or early October. It is a day dedicated to seeking forgiveness and making amends for sins. Observant Jews fast, pray, and confess their sins in synagogue. Some Jewish denominations also reflect on personal goals and achievements. Yom Kippur, along with Rosh Hashanah, forms the High Holy Days, and it marks the end of the Ten Days of Repentance.
title: Yom Kippur
